title: TestimonialCarousel
description: CRITICAL CONVERSION COMPONENT - Rotating carousel for displaying multiple customer testimonials. Social proof at scale that builds trust and drives conversions. Enables showing 10+ testimonials in compact space with auto-rotation to maximize social proof impact.

marketingContext.purpose: Social proof at scale - showcase multiple testimonials in rotating carousel to build credibility and drive conversions
marketingContext.conversionImpact: CRITICAL - 72% of customers won't take action until reading reviews (BrightLocal). Carousels enable showing 10+ testimonials vs. 1-3 static testimonials, multiplying social proof impact. Auto-play increases testimonial views by 200-300%.
bestPractices: Auto-play with 5-7 second delay (keeps content fresh, increases views)
Pause on hover/focus (allows reading at user pace)
Mix testimonial types (text, video, industry variety)
Place strategically: After features, before pricing, before final CTA
Featured variant for hero sections (prominent first testimonial)
Grid variant for testimonial pages (show multiple at once)
Include specific results in quotes ('127% increase' > 'great results')
Video testimonials when available (53% more trust than text)
Enable keyboard navigation (arrow keys) for accessibility
Mobile swipe support for touch devices
Show customer photos and company logos (adds credibility)
realWorldExamples: SaaS landing pages: Rotating customer success stories below hero
Product pages: Feature testimonials between product sections
Pricing pages: Testimonials before final CTA to overcome objections
Case study pages: Related customer testimonials at bottom
Homepage: Auto-rotating testimonials in dedicated section
abTestRecommendations: Auto-play: Enabled vs. Disabled (typically 2-3x more testimonial views with auto-play)
Delay timing: 5s vs. 7s vs. 10s (5-7s optimal for most use cases)
Layout: Single vs. Grid vs. Featured (context-dependent)
Navigation: Arrows + Dots vs. Dots only (arrows improve engagement)
Testimonial count: 5 vs. 10 vs. 15+ (more variety = more credibility)
Video placement: Video testimonials first vs. Mixed with text
psychologyPrinciples: Social Proof at Scale: Multiple testimonials compound credibility (10+ testimonials = 'popular' signal)
Variety Effect: Different industries/roles/use cases show broad appeal
Curiosity Gap: Auto-rotation creates desire to see 'what's next'
Consensus Building: Many positive reviews create bandwagon effect
Recency: Rotating content keeps social proof feeling fresh
Authority by Association: Mix of well-known companies/logos adds prestige

testimonials.description: Array of testimonial objects (REQUIRED). Each testimonial follows Testimonial molecule schema. Minimum 3-5 recommended for variety, 10+ ideal for maximum social proof.

items.description: Testimonial object with quote, author, rating, etc. See Testimonial molecule schema for full structure.

autoplay.description: Auto-play configuration (optional). Auto-play increases testimonial views by 200-300% but should pause on hover/focus for accessibility.

enabled.description: Enable auto-play rotation (default: false). Recommended TRUE for landing pages.

delay.description: Delay between slides in milliseconds (default: 5000). Recommended 5000-7000ms for reading comfort.

pauseOnHover.description: Pause auto-play on hover/focus (default: true). Recommended TRUE for accessibility.

showArrows.description: Show prev/next navigation arrows (default: true). Arrows improve engagement by 40%+ vs. dots only.

showDots.description: Show dot indicators for pagination (default: true). Dots help users understand testimonial count and position.

requirements: role='region' with aria-label='Customer testimonials' on container
ARIA live region (aria-live='polite') announces slide changes to screen readers
Navigation buttons have descriptive aria-label ('Previous testimonial', 'Next testimonial')
Dot indicators have role='tab' and aria-current='true' for active slide
Each slide has aria-label with position ('Testimonial 1 of 5')
Auto-play pauses on hover/focus (respects user control)
Auto-play disabled when prefers-reduced-motion is active
Keyboard navigation with arrow keys for prev/next
Focus styles clearly visible (2px outline, 2px offset)
Touch targets â‰¥44x44px for navigation controls and dots
Color contrast 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI controls
Screen reader announcement of current slide and total count

optimizations: CSS scroll-snap for baseline carousel (no JavaScript required)
Progressive enhancement with minimal JavaScript for auto-play and arrows
Lazy loading on testimonial images (inherited from Testimonial molecule)

details.mobile: Touch/swipe support, arrows hidden, single slide visible (or scroll variant), dots below
details.tablet: 2 slides visible (grid variant), arrows visible, standard layout
details.desktop: 3 slides visible (grid variant), all controls visible, featured variant enlarged

dos: Mix testimonial types (text, video, different industries)
Include specific results in quotes ('127% increase')
Add customer photos and company logos
Enable auto-play for landing pages (increases views 2-3x)
Set 5-7 second delay for comfortable reading
Place before pricing or final CTA (overcome objections)
Use verified badges when available (increases trust 15%)
Prioritize video testimonials (53% more trust than text)
Update testimonials regularly (keep fresh and relevant)
donts: Don't show just 1-2 testimonials (use static Testimonial component instead)
Don't auto-play too fast (<4s) or too slow (>10s)
Don't disable pause on hover (accessibility issue)
Don't use fake testimonials or stock photos
Don't mix low-quality testimonials with high-quality ones
Don't hide navigation controls without good reason
Don't auto-play when prefers-reduced-motion is active
Don't use vague testimonials ('great product' alone)
Don't place carousel below the fold on high-intent pages
